message.content:
Research Roo Code for Visual Studio Code. Find information about:
1. What is Roo Code? (features, capabilities)
2. How does it work? (architecture, AI models it uses)
3. Pricing model
4. Key strengths and limitations
5. User reviews and common feedback

Use web search to find current information about Roo Code VS Code extension. Provide a comprehensive summary.

Links: [{"title":"Roo Code Pricing | Roo Code","url":"https://roocode.com/pricing"},{"title":"Claude Code vs Roo Code: Features, Pricing and User Reviews 2025","url":"https://toolquestor.com/vs/claude-code-vs-roo-code"},{"title":"Roo Code - Visual Studio Marketplace","url":"https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=RooVeterinaryInc.roo-cline"},{"title":"Cursor vs Roo Code: Features, Pricing and User Reviews 2025","url":"https://toolquestor.com/vs/cursor-vs-roo-code"},{"title":"OpenAI Codex vs Roo Code: Features, Pricing and User Reviews ...","url":"https://toolquestor.com/vs/openai-codex-vs-roo-code"},{"title":"Roo Code Reviews in 2025","url":"https://sourceforge.net/software/product/Roo-Code/"},{"title":"Roo Code review: Autonomous AI-powered development in the IDE | InfoWorld","url":"https://www.infoworld.com/article/4019646/roo-code-review-a-first-look-at-autonomous-ai-powered-development-in-the-ide.html"},{"title":"Cline vs Roo Code vs Cursor | Better Stack Community","url":"https://betterstack.com/community/comparisons/cline-vs-roo-code-vs-cursor/"},{"title":"Roo Code vs Cline: Best AI Coding Agents for VS Code (2026)","url":"https://www.qodo.ai/blog/roo-code-vs-cline/"},{"title":"Roo Code ‚Äì The AI dev team that gets things done","url":"https://roocode.com/"}]

Based on the search results, here's the pricing information for Roo Code VS Code extension in 2025:

## Roo Code Pricing Plans

### Core Extension
Roo Code follows a flexible pricing approach that puts you in control of costs. The extension itself is completely free and open-source.(no content)You never pay subscription fees to use Roo Code.

### Cloud Free Plan
The Cloud Free plan costs nothing and includes token usage tracking, the ability to follow tasks from anywhere, task sharing with others, early access to free AI models, and community support through Discord and Reddit.

### Pro Plan
For advanced users, Pro costs $20 per month plus $5 per hour for cloud tasks. This adds cloud agents like PR Reviewer, remote task control called Roomote Control, and paid support.

### Team Plan
Team plans cost $99 monthly plus $5 per hour for cloud tasks. This includes unlimited team members with no per-seat charges, shared settings and rules, and centralized billing for the whole team.

### Cloud Agents (Additional Cost)
To cover infrastructure costs, they charge $5/hour while the agent is running (independent of inference costs). There are no markups, no tiers, no dumbing-down of models to increase profit.

### Important Note
While Roo Code is free, you'll pay for API calls to your provider at whatever rate it charges. This means you need to bring your own API key from providers like OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, or OpenRouter.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"Roo Code ‚Äì The AI dev team that gets things done","url":"https://roocode.com/"},{"title":"GitHub - RooCodeInc/Roo-Code: Roo Code gives you a whole dev team of AI agents in your code editor.","url":"https://github.com/RooCodeInc/Roo-Code"},{"title":"Roo Code: A Guide With 7 Practical Examples | DataCamp","url":"https://www.datacamp.com/tutorial/roo-code"},{"title":"Free AI Coding Assistant: Setup Roo Code with Free LLM Models | by Rob Felix | Four Nine Digital | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/four-nine-digital/free-ai-coding-assistant-setup-up-roo-code-with-free-llm-models-04beca21793d"},{"title":"Roo Code review: Autonomous AI-powered development in the IDE | InfoWorld","url":"https://www.infoworld.com/article/4019646/roo-code-review-a-first-look-at-autonomous-ai-powered-development-in-the-ide.html"},{"title":"Roo Code Docs | Roo Code Documentation","url":"https://docs.roocode.com/"},{"title":"Somi","url":"https://somi.ai/products/roo-code"},{"title":"How I Effectively Use Roo Code for AI-Assisted Development","url":"https://spin.atomicobject.com/roo-code-ai-assisted-development/"},{"title":"Model Providers | Roo Code Documentation","url":"https://docs.roocode.com/providers/"},{"title":"Roo Code vs Cline: Best AI Coding Agents for VS Code (2026)","url":"https://www.qodo.ai/blog/roo-code-vs-cline/"}]

Based on my search, here's what I found about Roo Code, VS Code architecture, and AI models:

## Roo Code Overview

Roo Code is open-source and fully customizable, letting you integrate any AI model you choose (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, local LLMs, etc.).(no content)It's a powerful Visual Studio Code extension that integrates large language models (LLMs) directly into your development environment, enabling you to code, debug, and ideate with AI in real-time.

## Architecture and Modes

Roo Code uses specialized modes (Architect, Code, Test) to handle multi-step tasks with deep project context. Modes are specialized AI agents focused on specific tasks like architecture, coding, testing, or documentation. Each mode has limited tool access to stay focused on its job. Modes are smart enough to request switching when a task falls outside their responsibilities, keeping work organized and efficient.(no content)Configuration profiles allow you to assign different AI models and settings to specific modes, like using o3 for architecture planning and Claude Sonnet 4 for code execution.(no content)Roo uses multi-agent, role-driven execution, while alternatives like Cline provide model-agnostic, stepwise planning.

## AI Model Support

Other tools are intrinsically bound by design to a specific provider (like Claude Code ‚Üí Anthropic Models or Codex ‚Üí OpenAI models). Roo on the other hand is model-agnostic, allowing you to choose the model that best fits your needs, according to your budget, skill profile, codebase and more. They support connecting to a wide range of model providers, giving you flexibility in how you access AI models.(no content)Roo isn't an LLM model itself; it needs an LLM provider to work. But it's compatible with dozens of providers and hundreds of models, so you're free to experiment, optimize and switch around, by design. No lock-ins in a world where "the best model" changes every other week.

## Key Features

- It's built for multi-file edits, so it can read, refactor, and update multiple files at once for holistic code changes. Its agentic abilities go beyond a typical AI autocomplete, enabling it to run tests, open a browser, and handle deeper tasks.

- Roo Code VS Code Extension works locally in your VS Code IDE and gives you full control over your coding experience. It's great for deep or highly iterative solo development work. It's highly customizable and fits into your existing workflow.

- The extension is free forever and works with your choice of AI models through a bring-your-own-key approach. You control costs by paying providers directly with no markups.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Roo Cline) is a VS Code plugin that enhances coding with AI-powered automation, multi-model support, and experimental features","url":"https://github.com/qpd-v/Roo-Code"},{"title":"Roo Code:Open-source VS Code extension providing specialized modes for planning, coding, debugging, and architecture with flexible multi-model support. - MOGE","url":"https://moge.ai/product/roo-code"},{"title":"Free AI Coding Assistant: Setup Roo Code with Free LLM Models | by Rob Felix | Four Nine Digital | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/four-nine-digital/free-ai-coding-assistant-setup-up-roo-code-with-free-llm-models-04beca21793d"}]

Based on my search results, here's what I found about Roo Code VS Code extension and its 2025 features and capabilities:

## Roo Code VS Code Extension Overview

Roo Code is an open-source, AI-powered coding assistant that runs in VS Code. It goes beyond simple autocompletion by reading and writing across multiple files, executing commands, and adapting to your workflow‚Äîlike having a whole dev team right inside your editor.

### Key Features & Capabilities

**Specialized Modes:**
Roo Code features distinct specialized modes (Code, Architect, Ask, Debug, and Orchestrator) that tailor the assistant's behavior and permissions for specific development tasks.(no content)Roo's Modes keep models focused on a given task and limit their access to tools which are relevant to their role, keeping the context window clearer and avoiding surprises. Modes are even smart enough to ask to switch to another when stepping outside their responsibilities.

**Model Agnostic Architecture:**
Roo Code is open-source and fully customizable, letting you integrate any AI model you choose (e.g, OpenAI, Anthropic, local LLMs, etc.).(no content)It works great with tens of models, from frontier to open weight. Choose from the curated selection offered at-cost or bring your own key.

**Extensibility via MCP:**
MCP (Model Context Protocol) allows Roo-Code to connect with external tools and services, such as databases or APIs. This framework enables you to integrate Roo-Code into your existing workflows and even create your own custom development tools.

**Memory & Context Management:**
For maintaining project understanding over time, Roo-Code can be used with a Memory Bank to remember important details. You can also use context mentions (typing @) to include specific files, terminal output, or other relevant information directly in your prompts.

**Boomerang Tasks:**
The Boomerang Tasks feature helps break down complex coding challenges into smaller, more manageable subtasks, allowing Roo-Code to handle intricate workflows more effectively.

**File Operations & Code Generation:**
Roo-Code possesses the capability to directly access and manipulate files within the user's project workspace. This includes generating new code, modifying existing files, and performing other file-related operations. When changes are made to files, Roo-Code conveniently displays diffs, allowing developers to easily review the proposed modifications before accepting them.

**2025 Updates:**
Version 3.23 (July 10, 2025) introduced stable codebase indexing and a new todo list feature.

**Additional Capabilities:**
The extension excels at multi-file edits, terminal command execution, browser automation for testing, and intelligent task coordination across development phases.

**Security & Open Source:**
The Roo Code Extension is open source so you can see for yourself exactly what it's doing and they don't use your data for training. Plus they're fully SOC2 Type 2 compliant and follow industry-standard security practices.

**Pricing:**
The core Roo Code extension is completely free and open-source. You only pay for any paid LLM usage (e.g., OpenAI API costs) if you choose those models.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"Frequently Asked Questions | Roo Code Documentation","url":"https://docs.roocode.com/faq"},{"title":"Using VS Code Language Model API With Roo Code | Roo Code Documentation","url":"https://docs.roocode.com/providers/vscode-lm"},{"title":"GitHub - RooCodeInc/Roo-Code: Roo Code gives you a whole dev team of AI agents in your code editor.","url":"https://github.com/RooCodeInc/Roo-Code"},{"title":"Roo Code review: A perspective on AI-powered coding - Qubika","url":"https://qubika.com/blog/roo-code/"},{"title":"Roo Code Docs | Roo Code Documentation","url":"https://docs.roocode.com/"},{"title":"Diagnostics Integration | Roo Code Documentation","url":"https://docs.roocode.com/features/diagnostics-integration"},{"title":"Installing Roo Code | Roo Code Documentation","url":"https://docs.roocode.com/getting-started/installing"},{"title":"Roo Code - Visual Studio Marketplace","url":"https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=RooVeterinaryInc.roo-cline"},{"title":"Errors and Repeated Use Limitations ¬∑ Issue #6834 ¬∑ RooCodeInc/Roo-Code","url":"https://github.com/RooCodeInc/Roo-Code/issues/6834"},{"title":"Roo Code ‚Äì The AI dev team that gets things done","url":"https://roocode.com/"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about Roo Code VS Code extension limitations, problems, and issues:

## Key Limitations and Issues

### Token Consumption & Cost
Roo Code consumes a great amount of tokens, as it is a BYOK (Bring your own Key) tool.(no content)For the features tested, it used around USD 50 in tokens (for entities creation, CRUD, seeding, UI changes).(no content)It's unapologetically powerful and customizable, and it costs more to run than the alternatives because it uses frontier models with actual file system access, terminal control, and multi-step workflows. Roo's approach is to trade tokens for quality.

### Session Limitations
It only supports one session per VSCode window. This limits the amount of parallel tasks it can tackle.

### Context and Model Issues
When Roo Code is working on a task, do not change the model selected, or it will lose its context and may redo existing work.(no content)It does not test the changes for you unless prompted and that responsibility goes to the user. This could be solved by editing the prompts to add an instruction to do so.

### VS Code Language Model API Integration
This integration is highly experimental and may not work as expected. It is dependent on other extensions correctly implementing the VS Code Language Model API. The Language Model API is available through VS Code (and is not currently supported by Cursor).

### Terminal Command Issues
If you're experiencing issues with terminal commands, see the Shell Integration Guide for troubleshooting.

### Installation Requirements
Verify VS Code version 1.84.0 or later. If VS Code Marketplace is inaccessible, try the Open VSX Registry method.

### Codebase Indexing Dependencies
Codebase Indexing requires an OpenAI API key for generating embeddings and a Qdrant vector database for storage. Costs depend on your project size and the embedding model used.

### Known Bugs
There are reported issues with the "Errors and Repetition Limit" feature where even when set to 1, tool calls work normally but an error message is given at the end indicating "a failure in the model's thought process or inability to use a tool properly."

### Troubleshooting Resources
If the problem persists, report the issue on GitHub or Discord. The documentation also recommends checking the Output panel for errors and ensuring a stable internet connection.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

## Key Limitations and Issues

### Token Consumption & Cost
Roo Code consumes a great amount of tokens, as it is a BYOK (Bring your own Key) tool.(no content)For the features tested, it used around USD 50 in tokens (for entities creation, CRUD, seeding, UI changes).(no content)It's unapologetically powerful and customizable, and it costs more to run than the alternatives because it uses frontier models with actual file system access, terminal control, and multi-step workflows. ### Session Limitations

### Context and Model Issues

This could be solved by editing the prompts to add an instruction to do so.

### VS Code Language Model API Integration
This integration is highly experimental and may not work as expected. It is dependent on other extensions correctly implementing the VS Code Language Model API. The Language Model API is available through VS Code (and is not currently supported by Cursor).

If you're experiencing issues with terminal commands, see the Shell Integration Guide for troubleshooting.

### Installation Requirements

### Codebase Indexing Dependencies
Codebase Indexing requires an OpenAI API key for generating embeddings and a Qdrant vector database for storage. Costs depend on your project size and the embedding model used.

If the problem persists, report the issue on GitHub or Discord. The documentation also recommends checking the Output panel for errors and ensuring a stable internet connection.

Based on the search results, here's a comprehensive overview of Roo Code for VS Code, including user reviews, feedback, pros, and cons from 2025:

## What is Roo Code?

Roo Code, which was previously recognized as Roo Cline, is an autonomous coding agent powered by artificial intelligence and integrated within Visual Studio Code to boost the efficiency of software development.(no content)It started as a fork of Cline ‚Äì another extension with similar capabilities.

## Key Features

The tool enables users to interact in natural language, which simplifies the processes of code generation, refactoring, debugging, and documentation updates. It possesses the ability to directly read and write files in the workspace, run terminal commands, and automate actions in web browsers.(no content)Compatible with any OpenAI-compatible or custom models and APIs, Roo Code offers a variety of customizable modes, such as Code Mode for routine coding tasks, Architect Mode for designing systems, Ask Mode for posing questions, Debug Mode for resolving issues, and user-defined Custom Modes tailored for specific tasks.

## Pros

1. **Free and Open Source**: Roo Code is completely free and open-source. You'll only pay for the AI model usage if you use a paid API (like OpenAI). If you choose free or self-hosted models, there's no cost at all.

2. **Frequent Updates & Active Community**: "Tons of features and new updates coming near daily. There is a large community in Discord and a ton of information available."

3. **Fast Development Team**: "Roo Code has the best features and capabilities, along with the best development team. I swear, they're the fastest to support new models and implement useful functionality whenever users mention it."

4. **Model Flexibility**: It works great with dozens of models, from frontier to open weight. You can choose from the curated selection offered at-cost or bring your own key.

5. **Local Control & Privacy**: Because Roo Code is an extension in your local VS Code, your code never leaves your machine unless you connect to an external AI API. Even then, you control exactly what is sent to the AI model.

6. **IDE Integration**: Roo Code integrates directly into your existing VSCode environment, allowing you to use all your familiar tools and settings. It works with your local development environment, enabling direct file manipulation in your editor without requiring additional cloud resources.

7. **Multi-file Operations**: It's built for multi-file edits, so it can read, refactor, and update multiple files at once for holistic code changes.

8. **Permission-Based Control**: You're always in control: Roo Code is permission-based, meaning you can control and approve any file changes or command executions.

## Cons

1. **Prompt Sensitivity**: Drawbacks include occasional prompt sensitivity leading to iterative fixes and higher token usage in complex scenarios.

2. **Context Loss When Switching Models**: When Roo Code is working on a task, do not change the model selected, or it will lose its context and may redo existing work.

3. **No Automatic Testing**: It does not test the changes for you unless prompted and that responsibility goes to the user. This could be solved by editing the prompts to add an instruction to do so.

4. **Large Repository Limitations**: Scaling context in context window across large repositories still requires manual hints (@file or @dir references).

5. **API Costs Can Add Up**: With cloud-hosted backends comes a steep cost, as you pay per token. In complex refactoring, you quickly end up with millions of tokens used. This takes the fun out of it quite a bit, e.g., for recreational coding projects.

6. **Terminal Configuration May Be Required**: One reviewer noted they "had to fiddle with the terminal defaults to get the console commands working properly" when on Windows with Git Bash, requiring a switch to PowerShell.

## User Sentiment

"Roo Code is an absolute game-changer! üöÄ It makes coding faster, easier, and more intuitive with its smart AI-powered suggestions, real-time debugging, and automation features. The seamless integration with VS Code is a huge plus, and the constant updates ensure it keeps getting better."(no content)"I switched from Windsurf to Roo Code in January and honestly, it's been a huge upgrade. Windsurf kept making mistakes and being dumb when I ask it for things. Roo just gets it."

## Comparison Note

In comparisons, Roo Code offers greater flexibility than GitHub Copilot, which focuses on inline completions but lacks agentic multi-step tasks. Copilot uses a subscription model starting at $10 monthly, while Roo Code remains free, with costs tied only to selected AI APIs.

Based on the search results, here's a comprehensive overview of Roo Code for VS Code, including user reviews, feedback, pros, and cons from 2025:

## What is Roo Code?

Roo Code, which was previously recognized as Roo Cline, is an autonomous coding agent powered by artificial intelligence and integrated within Visual Studio Code to boost the efficiency of software development.(no content)It started as a fork of Cline ‚Äì another extension with similar capabilities.

## Key Features

The tool enables users to interact in natural language, which simplifies the processes of code generation, refactoring, debugging, and documentation updates. It possesses the ability to directly read and write files in the workspace, run terminal commands, and automate actions in web browsers.(no content)Compatible with any OpenAI-compatible or custom models and APIs, Roo Code offers a variety of customizable modes, such as Code Mode for routine coding tasks, Architect Mode for designing systems, Ask Mode for posing questions, Debug Mode for resolving issues, and user-defined Custom Modes tailored for specific tasks.

## Pros

1. **Free and Open Source**: Roo Code is completely free and open-source. You'll only pay for the AI model usage if you use a paid API (like OpenAI). If you choose free or self-hosted models, there's no cost at all.

2. **Frequent Updates & Active Community**: "Tons of features and new updates coming near daily. There is a large community in Discord and a ton of information available."

3. **Fast Development Team**: "Roo Code has the best features and capabilities, along with the best development team. I swear, they're the fastest to support new models and implement useful functionality whenever users mention it."

5. **API Costs Can Add Up**: With cloud-hosted backends comes a steep cost, as you pay per token. In complex refactoring, you quickly end up with millions of tokens used. This takes the fun out of it quite a bit, e.g., for recreational coding projects.

6. **Terminal Configuration May Be Required**: One reviewer noted they "had to fiddle with the terminal defaults to get the console commands working properly" when on Windows with Git Bash, requiring a switch to PowerShell.

## User Sentiment

"Roo Code is an absolute game-changer! üöÄ It makes coding faster, easier, and more intuitive with its smart AI-powered suggestions, real-time debugging, and automation features. The seamless integration with VS Code is a huge plus, and the constant updates ensure it keeps getting better."(no content)"I switched from Windsurf to Roo Code in January and honestly, it's been a huge upgrade. content.text:
## Roo Code for VS Code - Comprehensive Research Summary

### 1. What is Roo Code?

Roo Code is an **open-source, AI-powered autonomous coding agent** that runs as a VS Code extension. Originally forked from Cline (previously known as Roo Cline), it goes beyond simple code autocompletion by providing a full "dev team" of AI agents directly in your editor.

**Core Capabilities:**
- Read, write, and refactor code across multiple files simultaneously
- Execute terminal commands directly from the IDE
- Browser automation for testing workflows
- Natural language interaction for code generation, debugging, and documentation
- Direct file manipulation in your workspace
- Permission-based control (you approve all changes)

**Specialized Modes:**
- **Code Mode**: Routine coding tasks
- **Architect Mode**: System design and planning
- **Ask Mode**: Q&A and explanations
- **Debug Mode**: Issue resolution
- **Orchestrator Mode**: Task coordination
- **Custom Modes**: User-defined for specific workflows

---

### 2. How Does It Work? (Architecture & AI Models)

**Architecture:**
- Roo Code uses a **multi-agent, role-driven execution** model
- Specialized modes limit tool access to keep agents focused on their specific responsibilities
- Modes are intelligent enough to request switching when tasks fall outside their domain
- Supports **MCP (Model Context Protocol)** for connecting to external tools, databases, and APIs
- Includes **Memory Bank** for maintaining project context over time
- **Boomerang Tasks** feature breaks complex challenges into manageable subtasks

**AI Model Support:**
Roo Code is **completely model-agnostic** - unlike Claude Code (locked to Anthropic) or Codex (locked to OpenAI):
- Compatible with **dozens of providers and hundreds of models**
- Supports: OpenAI, Anthropic (Claude), Google Gemini, local LLMs, OpenRouter, and any OpenAI-compatible API
- Configuration profiles allow assigning different models to different modes (e.g., o3 for architecture, Claude Sonnet for coding)
- **Bring Your Own Key (BYOK)** approach - you connect directly to providers

---

### 3. Pricing Model

| Plan | Cost | Features |
|------|------|----------|
| **Extension (Core)** | Free forever | Full extension functionality, open-source |
| **Cloud Free** | $0/month | Token tracking, task sharing, community support |
| **Pro** | $20/month + $5/hr cloud tasks | Cloud agents (PR Reviewer), Roomote Control, paid support |
| **Team** | $99/month + $5/hr cloud tasks | Unlimited members (no per-seat fees), shared settings, centralized billing |

**Key Pricing Notes:**
- The extension itself is completely free and open-source
- You pay only for AI model API usage at provider rates (no markups)
- Cloud agents cost $5/hour while running (infrastructure cost)
- No subscription fees required to use the core extension

---

### 4. Key Strengths

1. **Free and Open Source**: No subscription fees, fully transparent codebase, SOC2 Type 2 compliant
2. **Model Flexibility**: Not locked to any provider; switch models as needed
3. **Active Development**: Near-daily updates, responsive team, large Discord community
4. **Privacy-Focused**: Code stays local unless you connect to external APIs; your data is not used for training
5. **Deep IDE Integration**: Works within your existing VS Code setup with all familiar tools
6. **Multi-file Operations**: Holistic code changes across entire projects
7. **Permission-Based Control**: You approve all file changes and command executions
8. **Extensible via MCP**: Connect to databases, APIs, and custom tools

---

### 5. Key Limitations

1. **High Token Consumption**: Complex tasks can use millions of tokens; one test reported ~$50 USD for entities/CRUD/UI changes
2. **Single Session per Window**: Cannot run parallel tasks in the same VS Code window
3. **Context Loss on Model Switch**: Changing models mid-task causes context loss and potential rework
4. **No Automatic Testing**: Does not run tests unless explicitly prompted
5. **Large Repository Challenges**: Scaling across large codebases requires manual @file or @dir hints
6. **Terminal Configuration**: May require configuration adjustments (especially on Windows with Git Bash)
7. **Experimental Features**: VS Code Language Model API integration is highly experimental

---

### 6. User Reviews & Common Feedback

**Positive Feedback:**
- "Absolute game-changer" - praised for smart suggestions, real-time debugging, automation
- "Best features and capabilities, along with the best development team"
- "Switched from Windsurf to Roo Code in January - huge upgrade"
- Frequent updates and active community support noted consistently

**Critical Feedback:**
- Prompt sensitivity can lead to iterative fixes
- API costs accumulate quickly for complex projects
- Some users report needing to fiddle with terminal defaults
- Occasional context management challenges with large tasks

**Overall Sentiment:**
Users generally praise Roo Code for its flexibility, active development, and powerful capabilities, while acknowledging the trade-off of higher token costs for quality results.

---

### Sources:
- [Roo Code Official Website](https://roocode.com/)
- [Roo Code VS Code Marketplace](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=RooVeterinaryInc.roo-cline)
- [Roo Code Documentation](https://docs.roocode.com/)
- [Roo Code GitHub Repository](https://github.com/RooCodeInc/Roo-Code)
- [Roo Code Pricing Page](https://roocode.com/pricing)
- [InfoWorld Review: Roo Code](https://www.infoworld.com/article/4019646/roo-code-review-a-first-look-at-autonomous-ai-powered-development-in-the-ide.html)
- [Qubika Review: Roo Code](https://qubika.com/blog/roo-code/)
- [Roo Code vs Cline Comparison (Qodo)](https://www.qodo.ai/blog/roo-code-vs-cline/)
- [SourceForge Roo Code Reviews](https://sourceforge.net/software/product/Roo-Code/)
- [DataCamp Roo Code Guide](https://www.datacamp.com/tutorial/roo-code)
